title: [K-12] Resident Learning Competency Enhancement Program Through Emergency Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic first-aid knowledge and mathematical problem-solving skills
context.additional_context: Simulation learning environment that recreates actual emergency situations through mathematical modeling

learning_goals: Analyze the decision-making process in emergency situations through mathematical modeling and develop optimal resource allocation strategies
Prioritize and mathematically design treatment protocols for multiple patient emergency cases within a limited timeframe

Learners can record the problem-solving process of three math problems with a team (3–4 members) in a simulation environment (e.g., GeoGebra, Desmos) within a week, document it in a digital portfolio (screenshots, explanatory text), and achieve a ‘B’ grade (70+ points) in at least four of the five teacher-provided rubric items (problem-solving strategy, collaboration participation, documentation completeness).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
